document.forum_title: Commodity News | Hellenic Shipping News Worldwide - Part 656
document.discussion_title: The country’s top producer of H-beams- Tokyo Steel has annou
document.topic_text: The country’s top producer of H-beams- Tokyo Steel has announced a rise of ¥ 500/ton in scrap purchasing prices effective June 19th, 2014 ie., today at the Okayama, Takamatsu and Utsunomiya works. Post cuts, the average scrap purchasing price now remain in the range ¥ 32,000~ ¥ 33,000/ton. The scrap purchasing prices at Okayama works in Western Japan were at ¥ 33,000/ton and those in Kyushu works remained flat at ¥ 33,000/ton. Tokyo Steel’s scrap purchasing prices in Tahara works in Central Japan were at ¥ 33,000/ton, while those in Takamatsu steel center were at ¥ 32,000/ton. The scrap purchasing prices at Utsunomiya works in northern Kanto have now increased to ¥ 33,000/ton. Earlier, the company had announced a rise of ¥ 500/ton in scrap purchasing prices at the Utsunomiya works effective last week ie., June 12th, 2014. Source: Scrap Monster

Tokyo Steel’s scrap purchasing prices in Tahara works in Central Japan were at ¥ 33,000/ton, while those in Takamatsu steel center were at ¥ 32,000/ton.
